Package photopack

Class threeController

java.lang.Object
photopack.threeController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class threeController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for the third screen of the application, which displays a list of albums for the user to view and edit. Allows for the addition, deletion, and renaming of albums, as well as the navigation to the fourth and sixth screens.

      Displays a warning message to the user.
      Parameters:

    • switchToSix

      public void switchToSix(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent click) throws IOException
      Switches the current window to the six.fxml window by loading the six.fxml file and setting the sixController as its controller. The sixController is constructed with the current user object. A new Scene is created with the loaded root and the current stage is set with this Scene.
      Parameters:
      click - The MouseEvent that triggers this method
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an error loading the six.fxml file

    • logOut

      public void logOut() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Logs out the current user and loads the login screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error loading the login screen FXML file
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found

    • switchToFour

      public void switchToFour(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent click, Album album) throws IOException
      Switches to the "four.fxml" file when the user double-clicks on an album in the list view, and passes the selected album to the controller of the "four.fxml" file.
      Parameters:
      click - The mouse event of the double-click action
      album - The selected album in the list view
      Throws:
      IOException - If the "four.fxml" file is not found or cannot be loaded
